meanings.definition: The most important or popular items in a publisher's catalog.
meanings.sent1: In the bookstore, the frontlists are the books that everyone wants to read.
meanings.sent2: The frontlists always attract a lot of attention from readers.
meanings.sent3: The frontlists decided to throw a party in the bookstore to celebrate their popularity.
meanings.sent4: The frontlists stood out like shining stars in the sea of books.
meanings.sent5: The frontlists were like celebrities in the world of publishing.

meanings.definition: To promote or feature prominently in a catalog or display.
meanings.sent1: Booksellers frontlists new releases to catch customers' eyes.
meanings.sent2: Publishers frontlists their bestsellers to increase sales.
meanings.sent3: The store manager frontlists the latest gadgets in the window display.
meanings.sent4: She frontlists the special offers to attract more shoppers.
meanings.sent5: The marketing team frontlists the upcoming events to create buzz.

meanings.definition: The act of showcasing or highlighting new or popular items.
meanings.sent1: The frontlists of the store change every week to feature different products.
meanings.sent2: The frontlists draw customers' attention to the latest trends.
meanings.sent3: During the event, the frontlists of the store were the center of attraction.
meanings.sent4: The frontlists of the exhibition were like a spotlight on the new products.
meanings.sent5: The frontlists of the store were like a treasure trove waiting to be explored.
